text: You approach this sign at an intersection. What does it mean?
options: Right turns have priority over straight traffic
You may continue straight or turn right, but left turns are not permitted
You may turn right only after stopping

text: If traffic lights are not working due to a power failure, how should drivers treat the intersection?
explanation: During an electrical power loss, traffic lights at intersections will not work. Yield the right-of-way to vehicles in the intersection and to vehicles entering the intersection from your right. Go cautiously and use the intersection the same way you would use an intersection with all-way stop signs.

text: Unless otherwise posted, what is the maximum speed limit in cities, towns, and villages?
explanation: Where there are no posted speed limits, the maximum speed is 50 km/h in cities, towns and villages.

text: What does this road sign indicate?
options: Hazard close to the edge of the road
explanation: This marker warns of a hazard near the edge of the road, such as a bridge support or barrier. The diagonal stripes point downward on the side you may safely pass.

text: If your turn signals are not working, what should you do?
explanation: If your turn signals and brake lights are not working, use hand and arm signals.

text: You see this sign ahead while driving on a city street. What must you do?
options: Stop immediately and wait until a crossing guard signals you
Slow down and be prepared to stop for children even if no crosswalk lines are visible
Continue at the speed limit unless children are already on the road
Honk to warn pedestrians you are approaching
explanation: This sign warns drivers that children may be crossing the road. You should slow down, watch carefully for children, and be prepared to stop.

text: What should drivers do when they see this detour sign?
options: Follow the detour only if your lane is blocked
Follow the detour marker until returning to the regular route
Ignore it unless a worker directs you
Turn at the next intersection of your choice
explanation: Detour signs guide drivers along a temporary route until normal traffic flow resumes.

text: How often should you check your mirrors while driving?
explanation: Develop a routine for looking ahead, behind and from side to side. Check your mirrors every five seconds or so, and check your blind spots by turning your head to look over your shoulder. Keep other drivers out of your blind spot by changing your speed and don't drive in other vehicles' blind spots. This is especially true when driving around large commercial vehicles, as they typically have large blind spots to the sides and back. Be extra careful at dusk and dawn when everyone has difficulty adjusting to the changing light.

text: What is the minimum distance required when passing a cyclist?
explanation: Drivers of motor vehicles must maintain a minimum distance of one metre, where practical. [cite: 722]

text: Before pulling out from a roadside stop, what is the first thing you should do?
explanation: Release the parking brake and move the gear selector to drive.
